OP is finding success in Diamond. I don't understand why, but he/she is winning fairly consistantly.

because of 3 things:

- MF is really really underrated atm, especially her laning-phase is absurdly strong...so it´s easy to get her snowballing vs opponents that give her an opening due to not taking the champ serious/knowing the matchup
- the build is cheap and if you´re already ahead it offers alright strength for little money - so it´s just a classical win-more snowball build
- while tanks would be a severe weakness for the build (flatpen is rather irrelevant for them, as is botrk without arp later on (and lw+wit´s end is just meh)) they are sort of out of the meta and thus he scales better into the game than he should do with those items

He builds BC instead of LW. Looks like BT against squishies and BC against armor. So you're basically getting double shred instead of the full AD build where your magic damage on W and E become basically nothing otherwise.

Plus there's the added bonus of giving your entire team 25 pen against your target, having 25 MR that most ADCs don't have, the extra HP from BC, and the chasing/kiting power of Phage + Furor + Strut (sometimes).

I really like MF and have had some mixed success with her, but it's always a struggle. I'm hoping you can explain why this works in more detail.

For example, I don't understand why this would be better on MF than on Kalista or Vayne who have stronger direct synergy with aspd. Or why is this especially good because of MF's W when W scales off AD? Is it because WE reduces magic resist and makes W stick?

Also, on-hit builds tend to fall off super hard end game compared to crit builds. Is your goal to be a strong duelist? Do you have to be a bully in lane? What are your power spikes? Which do you build first (I assume WE since it's super cheap)? Do you have to push for a mid-game win? Does the extra on-hit and MR shred apply to each ulti wave? What's your skill order?

So many questions!

Yeah, this build basically puckers up and really makes use of what MF has that others don't - the built in stacking magic damage from autos to be a true hybrid threat. Kalista/Vayne don't care about Wit's End - MF loves it, you apply W stacks faster and your W stacks hurt so so so much more. Usually, MF loves extended trades or duels - but BORK makes it so that MF loves the fight from the beginning to the end because of its current % health damage (which is physical - literally, it's nearly impossible to itemize against this damage mix). With these two items, you have the edge. I always get BORK first and then Wit's End and then go straight into IE if I'm ADC, but you'll look and see one of the games where I didn't have IE at all and also had a cleaver (my team was all AD in one game for example, so I focused on strengthening my magic damage and armor shred with my ult instead of itemizing crit and it was a piece of cake). If you get ahead with this build, it is really REALLY hard for the enemy team to come back - but even if you fall behind your damage will still be relevant. 

- Yes, if you don't build any crit and you're your team's marksman, your team's late game DPS will drop off significantly because usually the enemy marksman would have built crit. If you're in solo lane though it's not as bad if you don't build crit. :')

- This build just turns MF into an all around monster, not just a crazy duelist. You will melt tanks like butter, you will melt squishies like butter.

- I build BORK first and then Wit's End afterwards, but sometimes if I go back and I have enough for BF I just buy that for the early damage spike (I had a Soraka once so I didn't really care for sustain so I was like why not I'll just go IE first and then do BORK-WE).

- Usually as MF you wanna try to end the game sooner than later, so if its possible, yes. Most of the games I've won though have gone past mid game so it's not that crucial. 

- No, the ult only applies the W stack damage. The MR shred only applies from your autos. 

- I max R (duh!), then Q, then E, then W. E max is so so so much better second, the only thing W max gives you is 10% attack speed. E max gives more damage and a better slow, there's no reason not to max it second.

 If you have any more questions, you can totally ask or if you wanna see the build in action I have multiple replays that I can send you if you wanna watch it (???). So MF has an on-hit on W dealing 6% of her AD as magic damage. Basically with that build, you're not boosting at all the base damage of it. It does have an attack speed steroid and synergy with botrk/wit's end, but :
1) it falls off hard, because once you've build it, you're kinda out of options for on-hit. You could maybe think of a {{item:3931}} build but I honestly don't think MF would be a great jungler. So what, you're gonna build bruisery after that?
Compared to another adc, you might have a somehow strong phase midgame but you're gonna get destroyed/ severely outdamaged once they got their core items completed, on a crit build for instance where everything synergizes well with itself for stupid late game damage ({{item:3031}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3072}} ).
If you do a mix of a crit build and on-hit build, you'll have bad results because they have no synergy together, so it's gonna be kinda bad, really.
2) there are champions with simply higher synergy with attack speed on-hit builds ({{champion:11}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:19}} , hell even {{champion:96}} {{champion:67}}  have higher synergy with it).
